name: Worksheet
description: An Excel worksheet is a grid of cells. It can contain data, tables, charts, etc.

properties.name: charts
properties.description: Returns collection of charts that are part of the worksheet.

properties.name: id
properties.description: Returns a value that uniquely identifies the worksheet in a given workbook. The value of the identifier remains the same even when the worksheet is renamed or moved.

properties.name: position
properties.description: The zero-based position of the worksheet within the workbook.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The display name of the worksheet.

properties.name: tables
properties.description: Collection of tables that are part of the worksheet.

properties.name: protection
properties.description: Returns sheet protection object for a worksheet.

properties.name: pivotTables
properties.description: Collection of PivotTables that are part of the worksheet.

properties.name: names
properties.description: Collection of names scoped to the current worksheet.

methods.name: activate
methods.description: Activate the worksheet in the Excel UI.

methods.name: calculate
methods.description: Calculates all cells on a worksheet.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes the worksheet from the workbook.

methods.name: getCell
methods.description: Gets the range object containing the single cell based on row and column numbers. The cell can be outside the bounds of its parent range, so long as it's stays within the worksheet grid.

parameters.name: row
parameters.description: The row number of the cell to be retrieved. Zero-indexed.

parameters.name: column
parameters.description: the column number of the cell to be retrieved. Zero-indexed.

methods.name: getRange
methods.description: Gets the range object specified by the address or name.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: The address or the name of the range. If not specified, the entire worksheet range is returned.

methods.name: getPrevious
methods.description: Gets the worksheet that precedes this one. If there are no previous worksheets, this method will throw an error.

parameters.name: visibleOnly
parameters.description: If true, considers only visible worksheets, skipping over any hidden ones.

methods.name: getPreviousOrNullObject
methods.description: Gets the worksheet that precedes this one. If there are no previous worksheets, this method will return a null objet.

parameters.name: visibleOnly
parameters.description: If true, considers only visible worksheets, skipping over any hidden ones.

methods.name: getNext
methods.description: Gets the worksheet that follows this one. If there are no worksheets following this one, this method will throw an error.

parameters.name: visibleOnly
parameters.description: If true, considers only visible worksheets, skipping over any hidden ones.

methods.name: getNextOrNullObject
methods.description: Gets the worksheet that follows this one. If there are no worksheets following this one, this method will return a null object.

parameters.name: visibleOnly
parameters.description: If true, considers only visible worksheets, skipping over any hidden ones.

methods.name: getUsedRange
methods.description: The used range is the smallest range that encompasses any cells that have a value or formatting assigned to them. If the entire worksheet is blank, this function will return the top left cell (i.e.,: it will *not* throw an error).

parameters.name: valuesOnly
parameters.description: Considers only cells with values as used cells (ignoring formatting).

methods.name: getUsedRangeOrNullObject
methods.description: The used range is the smallest range that encompasses any cells that have a value or formatting assigned to them. If the entire worksheet is blank, this function will return a null object.

parameters.name: valuesOnly
parameters.description: Considers only cells with values as used cells.
